DataElement.preferredName: Hematopoietic Progenitor Cell Antigen CD34 Positive Selection Hematopoietic Stem Cell Graft Manipulation Other Diagnostic, Therapeutic, and Research Equipment Therapies Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe another cell selection system.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hematopoietic Progenitor Cell Antigen CD34 Positive Selection Hematopoietic Stem Cell Graft Manipulation Other Diagnostic, Therapeutic, and Research Equipment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Hematopoietic progenitor cell antigen CD34 (385 aa, 41 kD) is a cell motility process protein that is encoded by the human CD34 gene and has a role in cell-cell adhesion and may have a role in leukocyte migration._The separation of specific cells or cell populations from a heterogeneous mixture. Specifically it refers to the selective retention of a population of desired cells through recognition of cells bearing the specified characteristics._Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body._Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._Any object needed to perform a diagnostic, therapeutic or research activity.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A protein found on the surface of some bone marrow and blood cells.:The separation of specific cells or cell populations from a heterogeneous mixture. Specifically it refers to the selective retention of a population of desired cells through recognition of cells bearing the specified characteristics.

Concepts.definition: Hematopoietic progenitor cell antigen CD34 (385 aa, ~41 kDa) is encoded by the human CD34 gene. This protein plays a role in cell-cell adhesion and may have a role in leukocyte migration.
The selective retention of a population of desired cells through recognition of cells bearing specific characteristics.

Property.preferredName: Hematopoietic Stem Cell Graft Manipulation Other Diagnostic, Therapeutic, and Research Equipment
Property.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.:Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner.:Not otherwise specified.:An object needed to perform a diagnostic, therapeutic or research activity.

Concepts.definition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.
Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A manufactured object that is used to perform diagnostic, therapeutic or research activities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An object needed to perform a diagnostic, therapeutic or research activity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
